testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 1. What is the story about?
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: A visit to the crocodile farm
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: A visit to the crocodile farm

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 2. How did the children get to the crocodile farm?
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: bus
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: bus

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 3. Complete the sentence: "Every night, before Ravi goes to bed, his mother ___"
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: reads him one of his favourite stories.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: reads his one of his favourite stories.

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 4. List two crocodile facts in the story.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: Any two: Crocodiles are reptiles. Some live in the sea, while others live in rivers.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: Any two: Crocodiles are reptiles. Some live in the sea, while others live in rivers.

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question:
5. Are the statements true or false?
5.1 Crocodiles are reptiles.
5.2 Sam was a very naughty boy.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer:
5.1 true
5.2 false
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer:
5.1 true
5.2 false

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question:
6. Match the characters with the correct information.
Characters: mother, Ravi.
Information: loved animals, read a story.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: mother read a story, Ravi loved animals
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: mother read a story, Ravu loved animals

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 7. Why did Josh fall off the wall?
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: Josh climbed on the wall to look at the crocodiles
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: Josh climbed on the wall to look at the crocodiles

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 8. List two words that rhyme with "crocodiles". One must be in the story.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: reptiles, smiles
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: reptiles, smiles

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 9. What do you think "tasty" means?
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: It tastes good. It has a nice flavour.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: It tastes good. It has a nice flavour.

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 10. Find a word in the story that has the same meaning as "small".
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: little
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: little

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 11. Fill in the missing sounds: A crocodile does not bru________ his tee________.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: sh, th
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: sh, th

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 12. Make a sentence using the word "book".
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: Your child writes his/her own sentence using the word "book"
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: Your child writes his/her own sentence using the word "book"

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question:
13. Rewrite the sentence using the correct punctuation.
"sam and ravi went to the crocodile farm on tuesday, said Mom"
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: "Sam and Ravi went to the crocodile farm on Tuesday," said Mom.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: "Sam and Ravi went to the crocodile farm on Tuesday," said Mom.

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 14. Did Ravi fall into the crocodile den?
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: no
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: no

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question:
15. Write sentences using these words.
15.1 road
15.2 rode
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer:
A road is a way leading from one place to another.
He rode his bike to the park.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer:
A road is a way leading from one place to another.
The word "rode" is the past tense of the word "ride".
testQuestionsWithAnswers.notes: Two sentences were required for each word

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 16. Have you ever seen a crocodile smile?
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: Your child writes his/her own answer
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: Your child writes his/her own answer

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question:
17. Underline the verb in each sentence.
17.1 A crocodile can move quickly in the water.
17.2 Would you swim with a crocodile?
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer:
17.1 move
17.2 swim
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer:
17.1 move
17.2 swim

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 18. Rewrite the sentence in cursive.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: (visual check)
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: (visual check)

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 19. Match the cursive letters with the print letters.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: (visual check)
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: (visual check)

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question: 20. Rewrite the sentence using the correct spacing.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: The lady at the crocodile farm teaches them about animals.
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: The lady at the crocodile farm teaches them about animals.

testQuestionsWithAnswers.question:
21. Write the capital letters in cursive.
A
B
G
H
testQuestionsWithAnswers.correctAnswer: (visual check)
testQuestionsWithAnswers.studentAnswer: (visual check)
